title: This Business Lobby Just Got Rinsed For Suggesting Penalty Rate Cuts Will Benefit Women - BuzzFeed News
text:
The cuts are expected to hit women hard, given they make up the majority of the workforce in the retail, accommodation and food services industries. But Pearson suggested the cuts will mean more businesses open for longer, leading to more opportunities for people who want to work extra hours.

— DukeLongley (@DukeLongley) ID: 10660018 A new poll of 3,515 residents in the federal electorates of Brisbane, Corangamite, Dawson, Page and Leichhardt found 66% of female voters and 58% of male voters disapproved of the penalty rate cuts.
It also found women were more cynical about the proposed effect of the cuts, with 35% believing they would result in more jobs for the affected industries, compared with 42% of men.
